Title: The Stranger
Author: Albert Camus
Description: A detached clerk kills a man in Algiers and faces legal consequences with chilling indifference.

Title: In Search of Lost Time
Author: Marcel Proust
Description: A monumental exploration of memory, time, and high society through the narrator's life.

Title: The Trial
Author: Franz Kafka
Description: A man is arrested and prosecuted by a remote, inaccessible authority for a crime never revealed.

Title: The Little Prince
Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Description: A stranded pilot meets a young prince from another planet who teaches him about love and life.

Title: Man's Fate
Author: André Malraux
Description: Set during the 1927 Shanghai insurrection, exploring the human condition and political idealism.

Title: Journey to the End of the Night
Author: Louis-Ferdinand Céline
Description: A cynical, misanthropic odyssey through WWI, colonial Africa, and urban America.

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Author: John Steinbeck
Description: An impoverished family of tenant farmers is driven from their Oklahoma home during the Great Depression.

Title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
Author: Ernest Hemingway
Description: An American volunteer in the Spanish Civil War is tasked with blowing up a bridge.

Title: Le Grand Meaulnes
Author: Alain-Fournier
Description: A haunting tale of lost love and the search for a mysterious, vanished estate.

Title: Froth on the Daydream
Author: Boris Vian, Stanley Chapman
Description: A surreal, tragicomic romance where a woman develops a water lily in her lung.

Title: The Second Sex
Author: Simone de Beauvoir
Description: A foundational feminist text analyzing the treatment of women throughout history.

Title: Waiting for Godot
Author: Samuel Beckett
Description: Two characters wait endlessly and fruitlessly for the arrival of someone named Godot.

Title: Being and Nothingness
Author: Jean-Paul Sartre
Description: A dense philosophical treatise on existentialism, free will, and the nature of consciousness.

Title: The Name of the Rose
Author: Umberto Eco
Description: A historical murder mystery set in an Italian monastery in 1327.

Title: The Gulag Archipelago
Author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn
Description: A harrowing account of the Soviet forced labor camp system based on eyewitness testimony.

Title: Paroles
Author: Jacques Prévert
Description: A collection of accessible, rebellious, and deeply influential French poetry.

Title: Alcools
Author: Guillaume Apollinaire
Description: A landmark collection of modernist poetry that experiments with form and removes punctuation.

Title: The Blue Lotus
Author: Hergé
Description: The fifth Tintin adventure, following the reporter to China to dismantle an opium ring.

Title: The Diary of a Young Girl
Author: Anne Frank
Description: The poignant real-life diary of a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis in Amsterdam.

Title: Tristes Tropiques
Author: Claude Lévi-Strauss
Description: A philosophical travelogue and anthropological study of indigenous tribes in Brazil.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A dystopian vision of a future society driven by genetic engineering and social conditioning.

Title: Nineteen Eighty-Four
Author: George Orwell
Description: A chilling portrayal of a totalitarian future under the constant surveillance of Big Brother.

Title: Asterix the Gaul
Author: René Goscinny, Albert Uderzo
Description: The first adventure of the indomitable Gauls resisting Roman occupation with magic potion.

Title: The Bald Soprano
Author: Eugène Ionesco
Description: A 'theatre of the absurd' play satirizing the banality of English middle-class life.

Title: Three Essays on the Theory of Sexuality
Author: Sigmund Freud
Description: Freud's groundbreaking work exploring the development of the sexual instinct.

Title: The Abyss
Author: Marguerite Yourcenar
Description: A historical novel following a 16th-century doctor and alchemist seeking intellectual freedom.

Title: Lolita
Author: Vladimir Nabokov
Description: A controversial masterpiece about a man's obsessive infatuation with a twelve-year-old girl.

Title: Ulysses
Author: James Joyce
Description: A complex modernist retelling of the Odyssey set during a single day in Dublin.

Title: The Tartar Steppe
Author: Dino Buzzati
Description: A soldier spends his life at a remote fort waiting for an enemy that never comes.

Title: The Counterfeiters
Author: André Gide
Description: A multi-layered novel exploring authenticity through a group of young men and writers.

Title: The Horseman on the Roof
Author: Jean Giono
Description: A young Italian officer journeys through a cholera-stricken Provence in the 1830s.

Title: Belle du Seigneur
Author: Albert Cohen
Description: A monumental love story satirizing the League of Nations and obsessive passion.

Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Author: Gabriel García Márquez
Description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the magical town of Macondo.

Title: The Sound and the Fury
Author: William Faulkner
Description: A complex narrative exploring the tragic downfall of the Compson family in the American South.

Title: Thérèse Desqueyroux
Author: François Mauriac
Description: A woman trapped in a stifling marriage attempts to poison her husband.

Title: Zazie in the Metro
Author: Raymond Queneau
Description: A mischievous girl visits Paris and experiences a surreal, linguistic-bending adventure.

Title: Confusion of Feelings
Author: Stefan Zweig
Description: An elderly professor recalls a formative, intense emotional relationship from his youth.

Title: Gone with the Wind
Author: Margaret Mitchell
Description: A sweeping epic of the American Civil War through the eyes of the headstrong Scarlett O'Hara.

Title: Lady Chatterley's Lover
Author: D. H. Lawrence
Description: A controversial novel exploring the physical and emotional relationship between a noblewoman and a gamekeeper.

Title: The Magic Mountain
Author: Thomas Mann
Description: A young man visits a Swiss sanatorium and becomes immersed in the philosophical debates of a dying Europe.

Title: Bonjour Tristesse
Author: Françoise Sagan
Description: A cynical teenager spends a summer in the French Riviera and plots to sabotage her father’s romance.

Title: Le Silence de la mer
Author: Vercors
Description: A story of quiet resistance in occupied France, told through a family's silence toward a German officer.

Title: Life: A User's Manual
Author: Georges Perec
Description: An intricate jigsaw puzzle of stories revolving around the inhabitants of a Parisian apartment building.

Title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
Author: Arthur Conan Doyle
Description: Sherlock Holmes investigates a supernatural spectral hound on the moors of Devon.

Title: Under the Sun of Satan
Author: Georges Bernanos
Description: A priest struggles with his faith and encounters the devil in rural France.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A tragic tale of obsession, wealth, and the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties.

Title: The Joke
Author: Milan Kundera
Description: A young man's life is ruined by a sarcastic postcard in communist Czechoslovakia.

Title: Contempt/A Ghost at Noon
Author: Alberto Moravia
Description: A writer's marriage disintegrates during the production of a film in Italy.

Title: The Murder of Roger Ackroyd
Author: Agatha Christie
Description: A classic Hercule Poirot mystery famous for its revolutionary narrative twist.

Title: Nadja
Author: André Breton
Description: A surrealist semi-autobiographical account of the author's relationship with a young woman.

Title: Aurélien
Author: Louis Aragon
Description: A tragic love story set in interwar Paris, exploring disillusionment and beauty.

Title: The Satin Slipper
Author: Paul Claudel
Description: A massive, poetic drama about Spanish conquistadors, destiny, and spiritual love.

Title: Six Characters in Search of an Author
Author: Luigi Pirandello
Description: Characters from an unfinished play appear at a rehearsal demanding their story be told.

Title: The Resistible Rise of Arturo Ui
Author: Bertolt Brecht
Description: A satirical allegory of Hitler's rise to power, set in the world of Chicago mobsters.

Title: Friday
Author: Michel Tournier
Description: A retelling of Robinson Crusoe that explores the psychological and philosophical impact of solitude.

Title: The War of the Worlds
Author: H. G. Wells
Description: An influential sci-fi novel depicting an invasion of Earth by Martians.

Title: If This Is a Man
Author: Primo Levi
Description: A powerful memoir of survival and humanity in the Auschwitz concentration camp.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: An epic high-fantasy trilogy about the quest to destroy a powerful, corrupting ring.

Title: The Tendrils of the Vine
Author: Colette
Description: A collection of poetic essays and observations on nature and the senses.

Title: Capital of Pain
Author: Paul Éluard
Description: A seminal collection of surrealist poetry exploring love, dreams, and suffering.

Title: Martin Eden
Author: Jack London
Description: A self-taught sailor struggles to become a successful writer to win the heart of a socialite.

Title: The Ballad of the Salty Sea
Author: Hugo Pratt
Description: The debut graphic novel featuring the enigmatic sailor-adventurer Corto Maltese.

Title: Writing Degree Zero
Author: Roland Barthes
Description: An influential work of literary theory examining the political and social nature of language.

Title: The Lost Honour of Katharina Blum
Author: Heinrich Böll
Description: A woman's life is destroyed by the sensationalist tactics of a tabloid newspaper.

Title: The Opposing Shore
Author: Julien Gracq
Description: A soldier waits at a border for an ancient war to resume in a dreamlike, atmospheric landscape.

Title: The Order of Things
Author: Michel Foucault
Description: A profound analysis of the history of the human sciences and the structures of knowledge.

Title: On the Road
Author: Jack Kerouac
Description: A defining work of the Beat Generation, chronicling cross-country travels across America.

Title: The Wonderful Adventures of Nils
Author: Selma Lagerlöf
Description: A mischievous boy is shrunk to miniature size and travels Sweden with wild geese.

Title: A Room of One's Own
Author: Virginia Woolf
Description: An extended essay arguing for the necessity of financial and physical space for female writers.

Title: The Martian Chronicles
Author: Ray Bradbury
Description: A series of linked stories about the colonization of Mars and the displacement of its natives.

Title: The Ravishing of Lol Stein
Author: Marguerite Duras
Description: A haunting psychological novel about a woman witnessing her fiancé's betrayal.

Title: The Interrogation
Author: J. M. G. Le Clézio
Description: A man wanders a sun-drenched city, possibly a deserter or a madman, undergoing a mental trial.

Title: Tropisms
Author: Nathalie Sarraute
Description: Experimental short prose pieces capturing the subtle, subconscious movements of the mind.

Title: Journal, 1887–1910
Author: Jules Renard
Description: Journal (Renard),"The witty and often bitter personal diaries of a significant French playwright and novelist.

Title: Lord Jim
Author: Joseph Conrad
Description: A sailor seeks redemption after abandoning a ship he believed was sinking.

Title: Écrits
Author: Jacques Lacan
Description: A complex collection of essays and lectures by the influential psychoanalyst Jacques Lacan.

Title: The Theatre and Its Double
Author: Antonin Artaud
Description: A manifesto calling for a 'Theatre of Cruelty' to shock and transform the audience.

Title: Manhattan Transfer
Author: John Dos Passos
Description: A kaleidoscopic novel capturing the chaotic energy and overlapping lives of New York City.

Title: Ficciones
Author: Jorge Luis Borges
Description: A collection of short stories famous for their mathematical, philosophical, and labyrinthine themes.

Title: Moravagine
Author: Blaise Cendrars
Description: A dark, frenetic novel about a professional killer and his companion traveling the world.

Title: The General of the Dead Army
Author: Ismail Kadare
Description: An Italian general travels to Albania to recover the remains of fallen soldiers.

Title: Sophie's Choice
Author: William Styron
Description: A young writer befriends a Holocaust survivor who harbors a devastating secret.

Title: Gypsy Ballads
Author: Federico García Lorca
Description: A vibrant collection of poetry celebrating and mourning the Gypsy culture of Andalusia.

Title: The Strange Case of Peter the Lett
Author: Georges Simenon
Description: The first Inspector Maigret novel, introducing the famous detective and his methods.

Title: Our Lady of the Flowers
Author: Jean Genet
Description: A poetic, transgressive novel written in prison, exploring the lives of outcasts.

Title: The Man Without Qualities
Author: Robert Musil
Description: A massive, unfinished novel analyzing the intellectual climate of the waning Austro-Hungarian Empire.

Title: Furor and Mystery
Author: René Char
Description: A collection of powerful poetry written by a leading figure of the French Resistance.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J. D. Salinger
Description: The quintessential novel of teenage angst and rebellion, featuring Holden Caulfield.

Title: No Orchids For Miss Blandish
Author: James Hadley Chase
Description: A gritty, controversial noir thriller about a kidnapping gone wrong.

Title: Blake and Mortimer
Author: Edgar P. Jacobs
Description: The first adventure of the British duo, focusing on global threats and high-tech mystery.

Title: The Notebooks of Malte Laurids Brigge
Author: Rainer Maria Rilke
Description: A semi-autobiographical novel exploring urban alienation, poverty, and death in Paris.

Title: Second Thoughts
Author: Michel Butor
Description: A pioneering 'nouveau roman' following a man's train journey and his shifting perceptions.

Title: The Origins of Totalitarianism
Author: Hannah Arendt
Description: A seminal political study of the roots of Nazi Germany and Stalinist Russia.

Title: The Master and Margarita
Author: Mikhail Bulgakov
Description: A supernatural satire in which the devil visits atheistic Soviet Moscow.

Title: The Rosy Crucifixion
Author: Henry Miller
Description: A fictionalized trilogy detailing the author's early struggles as a writer in New York.

Title: The Big Sleep
Author: Raymond Chandler
Description: The first Philip Marlowe novel, a classic of the hardboiled detective genre.

Title: Amers
Author: Saint-John Perse
Description: A majestic, expansive poem celebrating the sea as a source of life and renewal.

Title: Gaston
Author: André Franquin
Description: A comic strip featuring an incredibly lazy and accident-prone office assistant.

Title: Under the Volcano
Author: Malcolm Lowry
Description: The story of the final, alcohol-soaked day of a British consul in Mexico.

Title: Midnight's Children
Author: Salman Rushdie
Description: A magical realist epic following children born at the exact moment of India's independence.
